resources.string: Savings rate shows what percentage of your income you save. Calculated as (Income − Expenses) / Income × 100%. It is recommended to save 10–20% of income to achieve financial goals.
Detailed information about your financial condition and recommendations for improvement
Average expenses are calculated from your spending for the selected period. The analysis helps reveal trends and opportunities to optimize your budget.
Great job! Your savings rate is above 30%. Keep it up and consider investing part of your savings to generate extra income.
A solid savings rate of 15–30%. You are on track. Try to raise savings to about 20–25% to reach financial independence.
A savings rate of 5–15% leaves room for improvement. Start by increasing savings by 1–2% each month.
Savings below 5% require attention. Analyze expenses, find opportunities to save, and start setting aside at least 10% of income.
Savings rate shows what percentage of income you set aside. Calculated as (Income − Expenses) / Income × 100%.
Excellent emergency fund for 6+ months. Consider investing part of the funds.
Good emergency fund for 3–6 months. Keep building the reserve and aim for 6 months for maximum safety.
Emergency fund less than 3 months. Prioritize building a 3–6 month reserve.
An emergency fund is the amount that allows you to live 3–6 months without income. Calculated as average monthly expenses × number of months.
